function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Heterogeneous distribution of UGSs causing large areas to be further than a ten minutes walking distance, making them considered unavailable.","Impact":"Decreased accessibility to UGSs may lead to reduced physical activity and increased sedentary behavior, impacting public health.","Mitigation":"Improve the distribution and accessibility of UGSs through urban planning and infrastructure development to encourage physical activity.","Technologies":"Use geographic information systems (GIS) and urban planning software to analyze and plan the distribution of UGSs.","People":"Residents of districts with limited UGS accessibility.","Owner":"Local government, urban planners, and public health organizations."},{"Description":"Significant reduction in park attendance in District 1 due to low amount of residents in the district, which is mostly touristic and financial.","Impact":"Limited park attendance may impact public health and well-being negatively, reducing opportunities for outdoor physical activity and recreation.","Mitigation":"Promote park attendance through targeted recreational programs and events to attract residents and visitors to the area.","Technologies":"Use marketing and communication tools to promote park events and activities to the local community and tourists.","People":"Residents and tourists in District 1, recreational program organizers.","Owner":"Local government, tourism organizations, and event organizers."},{"Description":"High mobility rates in highly populated districts with low UGS densities, such as districts 6 and 7.","Impact":"Increased mobility in densely populated areas with limited UGSs may lead to higher risk of contagious disease transmission and overcrowding, impacting public health.","Mitigation":"Increase UGS density and accessibility in densely populated districts to disperse crowd and reduce transmission risk.","Technologies":"Utilize urban planning software to identify suitable areas for UGS development and create green spaces within densely populated districts.","People":"Residents of densely populated districts, public health organizations.","Owner":"Local government, urban planners, and public health organizations."}]}
